result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard R Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard R Scott

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Parker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 12 months w/conditions, consecutive to 07CF60 and concurrent to 14CF1409; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.
Sentencing on 10/15/15 at 2:30 changed to 10/14/15 at 2:00 on the Court's own motion.  Atty Parker and ADA Jennifer Phan notified by email.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Parker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 10/15/15 at 2:30pm.  Firearms warning given.  Bond continued.
filed by Atty Lara Parker
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty L Parker appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft was not writted for hearing.  PLEAS set for 9/2/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
to consolidate cases for trial filed by ADA Phan

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Koesser moves to withdraw.  Court allows Atty Koesser to withdraw as counsel.  Deft makes speedy trial demand.  STC/joinder motion set for 8/11/15 at 8:30am, JS 10/12/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty H Koesser appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Koesser states they are waiting to see what deft is receiving for his revocation in another matter.  FP continued to 7/22/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
Atty Hans Koesser

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Koesser states the deft has a revocation pending; believes further negotiations are needed in this case.  FP continued to 7/2/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hans Koesser. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Further proceedings on 6-8-15 @ 8:30am with 14CF1409. Bond continued.
